title: James Bond 'in touch with his feelings' for No Time To Die
text:
Naomie has revealed a new Bond (Picture: Getty Images)

As we eagerly await the release of the latest James Bond film, No Time To Die, star Naomie Harris has revealed how the titular character has changed.

Turns out, us audiences are going to be pretty shocked come April when previously-named Bond 25 lands in cinemas.

The film will see Daniel Craig shoot his way through what is believed to be his final turn as the suave spy 007, with chatter suggesting Lashana Lynch will take up the role of 007 going forward (not the role of Bond though, apparently).

Noamie, who plays Miss Moneypenny in the beloved franchise, said: ‘It’s a tie-up of Skyfall and Spectre. But with massive, massive surprises that even had me like, “Oh, wow!” So I think we’re going to really shock people.’

She continued to GQ Hype we may see a freshly emotional Bond, who is perhaps shirking the overly masculine caricature of the past

‘I would say that he’s reconnected with his heart. We’re deﬁnitely seeing a Bond who’s more in touch with his feelings and more open to falling in love,’ she continued.

‘At the end of Spectre there are women he gives his career up for: there’s no more emotional attachment than that. It’s just about moving with the times and recognising that women can no longer be seen as eye candy.’

It follows her earlier comments on the legendary fictional master, as she said at the May GQ Heroes summit: ‘The Bond of old, his days are numbered.’

Naomie is fast becoming a household name thanks to her roles in the Bond films, and after being nominated for the best supporting actress award for her role in Moonlight

‘I expected [Moonlight] to make a difference but not on the level it has,’ she revealed.

‘It’s completely changed my career. It’s changed how many offers I’ve got, the fee I can command, my standing in the industry, the respect I get given. It’s huge. I wouldn’t have been offered something of the exposure of Black And Blue before Moonlight.’

We won’t have to wait as long for Bond to hit screens, by the way, after the release date was moved forward.

By a day.

The film was originally scheduled to hit cinemas on 3 April in the UK and 8 April in the US, but has been bought forward a day by producers.

The new release date was revealed on global James Bond Day which also saw the release of a new poster, showing Daniel looking all kinds of moody in Bond’s signature tux and gazing intensely at something in the distance.

We’ll know what that something is in a few short months.

No Time To Die is in UK cinemas 2 April 2020.

Read the full interview on GQ Hype.
